body_html:
It's not just SpectralOps. All cuda files with tuples failed. It is because this NVCC bug where it doesn't work with gcc 6.4 tuple header nicely. This has also been reported in other projects as well. According to the NVIDIA forum thread, a fix will come out (at earliest) with next CUDA release.

For now, you can use gcc 6.3 or lower.
body_text:
It's not just SpectralOps. All cuda files with tuples failed. It is because this NVCC bug where it doesn't work with gcc 6.4 tuple header nicely. This has also been reported in other projects as well. According to the NVIDIA forum thread, a fix will come out (at earliest) with next CUDA release.
For now, you can use gcc 6.3 or lower.
body:
It's not just SpectralOps. All cuda files with tuples failed. It is because this NVCC [bug](https://devtalk.nvidia.com/default/topic/1028112/cuda-setup-and-installation/nvcc-bug-related-to-gcc-6-lt-tuple-gt-header-/) where it doesn't work with gcc 6.4 tuple header nicely. This has also been reported in [other](https://github.com/kokkos/kokkos/issues/1306) [projects](https://github.com/caffe2/caffe2/issues/1898) as well. According to the NVIDIA forum thread, a fix will come out (at earliest) with next CUDA release.

For now, you can use gcc 6.3 or lower.
